ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] patch messed up my sound in EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: My sound worked great, once I turned the sound on my computer off and put a Bob Marley CD in the stereo :)
ygData.messageBody:
My sound worked great, once I turned the sound on my computer off and put a
Bob Marley CD in the stereo :)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 16, 2000 8:51 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] patch messed up my sound in EQ
>
>
> ROFL, EVERYTHING was messed up last night.. sounds were
> distorted, health
> bars showing 2% heath when you hadn't even taken a hit.. my
> stomach even got
> upset from the weird sounds... some people had gamma
> problems, etc. Hoping
> that they fix this today
>
> Halana, 57th Shammie
> Tani, 35th Bardette
> Solusek Ro
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike.Roach@... [mailto:Mike.Roach@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 16, 2000 8:55 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] patch messed up my sound in EQ
>
> I think I made a boo-boo, I upgraded to DX8 when it came out
> last week and I
> noticed last night (post patch) that the sound affects for monster
> environmental sounds (clicking beetles when they walk, noises
> when you hit
> them etc.) were so faint I could only hear them if I put my
> ear right next
> to my speaker. I could, however, still hear howling wind and
> birds chirping
> and my own avatar's footsteps. Another weird thing is I
> could only hear
> spell sounds when someone cast the spell on me...It was an
> eerie night in
> Hate, too quiet.
>
> Maybe someone has some advice, I would hate to have to figure
> out how to
> back out DX8 manually that seems like a bad task.
>
> I am using a SoundBlaster Ensoniq PCI64 soundcard which came
> with my crappy
> HP Pavilion 8280 when I bought it 2 years ago and I have
> never had any video
> or sound problems before in EQ or anything else for that matter.
>
> -Faras
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
